revised_title: Adrenaline's Impact on Membrane Conductance in Guinea-Pig Taenia Coli Smooth Muscle
tldr: The study investigates the effects of adrenaline on the membrane conductance of the smooth muscle in the guinea-pig taenia coli. Adrenaline was found to increase the membrane's permeability to potassium and chloride ions, leading to hyperpolarization and a reduction in membrane resistance. This research provides insight into the complex mechanisms underlying the action of adrenaline on smooth muscle cells.
